alert.note: Alert for Eastern Uinta Basin (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued May 17 at 12:30PM MDT until further notice by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...The Flood Watch continues for the following rivers in Utah... Green River near Jensen affecting Eastern Uinta Basin. .The combination of warm, spring temperatures and the potential for periods of rain falling on a deep snowpack would lead to an increase in runoff from snowmelt. Flows in rivers may increase quickly and are expected to reach critical levels by Sunday afternoon. Fld Observed Forecasts (12 pm MDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Sat Sun Mon Green River Jensen 10.8 9.3 Wed 12 pm MDT 10.7 10.8 11.0 &&
info.instruction: If you are in the watch area, remain alert to possible flooding or the possibility of the watch being upgraded to an advisory or warning. UTZ024-191830- /O.CON.KGJT.FL.A.0003.000000T0000Z-000000T0000Z/ /JESU1.0.RS.000000T0000Z.000000T0000Z.000000T0000Z.NO/ 1230 PM MDT Wed May 17 2023 ...RIVER FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Flooding is possible. * WHERE...Green River near Jensen. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 9.5 feet, minor lowland flooding is expected along the Green River, impacting agricultural land and a few out buildings near the river. At 10.8 feet, The Green River has reached flood stage. Irrigation pumps and equipment near the river are impacted and water begins to flow into portions of the mobile home park near Stewart Lake. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:30 PM MDT Wednesday, May 17 the stage was 9.3 feet. - Forecast...Flood stage may be reached Sunday afternoon. - Flood stage is 10.8 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
